Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student can draw a single plant but may not accurately depict healthiness (e.g., simple outline of a plant).
The student might include basic elements such as the sun in their drawing without understanding its role (e.g., sun placed randomly).
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to accurately differentiate between a healthy and a wilted plant (e.g., both plants look similar, unclear which is wilted).
The student may not show the absence of water effectively in the wilted plant drawing (e.g., no representation of water presence or absence).
The student is unlikely to create a clear side-by-side comparison (e.g., plants may be scattered or random).
The student may misunderstand the role of the sun and place it incorrectly (e.g., beneath the plant).
